file_content.text: The Imperial Reclamation Service was most impressed to hear about your improbable victory.
A triumphant return! That is, my sensors tell me my renegade prisoners are all dead, for which I thank you.
Did the Jedi fall as well?
The Republic has learned not to underestimate our strength on Tatooine.
They are all dead.
You'd think that lesson would have stuck from the last war, no?
I did my part. Your turn now.
I'll make a transfer right now. You've certainly earned it.
Nothing like slaughtering Jedi to make you feel alive!
Best way to spend a day.
I'll, ah, take your word for it.
The Imperial Reclamation Service will hear all about your work defeating the two dozen Jedi who viciously ambushed us.
No, don't say anything. My initial count could have been off. They have no way to verify.
Let them be as impressed with you as I am.
Kill the prisoners, too. Let them learn that being captured was a mercy only granted once.
Ah, perhaps we stand a chance after all.
It is a relief to see you, my lord.
The entire Empire may one day have cause for gratitude that you arrived here at precisely this moment.
What happened to these men?
Are you under attack?
Cut down on the job by Jedi and their abominable allies.
What could possibly have happened here that's of interest to the entire Empire?
A slight exaggeration?
Well, perhaps I... overstated the case a bit. But you could certainly help us teach a lesson to those who deny our mastery of Tatooine.
Do I know you?
I am Officer Vengo, Imperial Reclamation Service. My men and I were escorting prison laborers to a Czerka dig site.
We were ambushed by a bunch of Republic cowards who cut down my men and freed the prisoners. There was a Jedi leading them.
As it happens, this wouldn't be the first Jedi I've crossed.
You want your prisoners back?
Perfect, my lord. It's a chance to bring the Emperor's justice to these zealots!
I could get your prisoners back. Jedi don't scare me.
You need a hand?
Your eagerness is heartening. Even Jedi should quail before such a group.
Then I bow to your skill, for you can see how my men fared against them.
A bold claim for a lone mercenary, but I'll not dispute it.
I've already overloaded the prisoners' shock collars--they should be quite injured. According to my sensors, they've stopped moving.
I expect they've gone to ground in the deep desert to tend the wounded. If you want to help, track them there... and make sure they never leave.
Why would a Jedi care about your prisoners?
Were the prisoners important?
Oh, some nonsense about them being Republic officers illegally detained under the terms of the Treaty of Coruscant.
The point is, these Republic scum can't get away with this.
I've activated the prisoners' shock collars, so they'll be severely injured. You would do the Empire a great service if you wished to... retrieve them.
It's my duty to rid the world of Jedi... one at a time.
Of course.
You are a credit to the Empire, my lord.
Do you prefer your Jedi dead or still squirming?
I will help.
Dead, my lord. I'm a simple man.
How much per head?
Depends on your offer.
I'm sure the Empire'll pay your going rate. And, um, leave the heads where they fall.
I'm quite interested to see the strength of the Republic's forces on Tatooine.
I'll take a look.
If they've brought Jedi, I imagine they're serious.
Let's talk reward.
I believe the Dark Council has a standing bounty on Jedi. I'll be sure you can collect.
The sensors in the prisoners' collars reveal no movement right now. It looks like they're holing up in the deep desert, probably to rest the wounded.
It's a dangerous area, but if the Sand People haven't killed them yet, make sure you do.
Do it yourself. [Refuse quest]
So go get them. [Refuse quest]
I'm sure you must have urgent business to attend to.
As you say, my lord.
The Imperial Reclamation Service will be pleased to hear that you helped.
I'm a little busy!
